title: Define Core IR types (System F_C expressions, binders, types)
body:
Define the Core IR type hierarchy modelled on GHC's System F_C.

**Deliverables:**
- `CoreExpr` tagged union:
  - `Var` — variable reference
  - `Lit` — literal (integer, char, string)
  - `App` — application (function, argument)
  - `Lam` — lambda (binder, body)
  - `Let` — let binding (recursive or non-recursive)
  - `Case` — case expression (scrutinee, binder, type, alternatives)
  - `Type` — type argument (for type application)
  - `Coercion` — coercion (placeholder; full coercions deferred)
- `CoreBind`: `NonRec(binder, expr)` | `Rec([(binder, expr)])`
- `CoreAlt`: `(AltCon, [binder], expr)` where `AltCon` is `DataAlt | LitAlt | Default`
- `CoreType` — Core's type representation (simpler than source types, post-elaboration)
- `Id` — variable/binder with `Name`, type, and metadata
- Unit tests for construction and equality

**Design notes:**
- Keep close to GHC Core for future interop (`-ddump-simpl` import)
- Coercions are part of System F_C but we can stub them initially (use `Refl` everywhere)
- No Core-to-Core optimisation passes (all deferred to GRIN per DESIGN.md)
- Reference: GHC's `compiler/GHC/Core/Syntax.hs`
